title: The Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis double
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Television programs - United States
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Entertainers
abstract: Television party for Muscular Dystrophy (dir. Stuart W. Phelps, 1950s, 91 min.)--At war with the army (dir. Hal Walker, 1950, 82 min.)
description: Television party for Muscular Dystrophy - Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis are joined by many of their Hollywood cohorts including Danny Thomas, Eddie Cantor, Phil Silvers, Jane Wyman, Vic Damone, Spike Jones in a televised live benefit show in aid of muscular dystrophy. (Winner of 1982 Vira Award for best Vintage Comedy Show). "At war with the army" - The first Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis comedy together. Martin has girl trouble so Lewis decides to lend him a hand, the ensuing comedy is a result of Jerry's questionable assistance, the early signs of Jerry Lewis's comedy genius are clearly evident.
